com.xd.cps2002.map

Class BasicMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xd.cps2002.map.Map
      • com.xd.cps2002.map.BasicMap

  • public class BasicMap
extends Map
    The BasicMap class is a concrete implementation of the Map class, and it contains the implementations of the Map.generate() and Map.isPlayable() functions particular to this type of map.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class com.xd.cps2002.map.Map

        size, tiles, treasurePos, winnableTiles

    • Constructor Detail

      • BasicMap

        protected BasicMap(int n)
        Constructor used to initialize an empty BasicMap object. It uses the constructor of the Map super class.
        Parameters:
        n - size of the n x n square map
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the method is given an invalid size parameter (outside of the range 5-50)
        Implementation Note:
        This constructor has a protected access modifier to stop client code from instantiating the class directly. However, unit tests can still call the constructor normally.

      • BasicMap

        protected BasicMap(TileType[][] tiles)
        Constructor used to initialize a BasicMap object with a pre-generated map. It also uses the constructor of the Map super class.
        Parameters:
        tiles - Pre-generated 2D array of n x n tiles to be used in the map.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if tiles is null, empty or if the lists in the 2D array do not have the same lengths.

    • Method Detail

      • setWaterTilePercentage

        public void setWaterTilePercentage(int minWaterTilePercent,
                                   int maxWaterTilePercent)
        This function is used to change the default percentages of water tiles in the entire map when generating the map. It changes the values stored in the members minWaterTilePercent and maxWaterTilePercent.
        Parameters:
        minWaterTilePercent - An integer from 0 to 64 (inclusive) representing the minimum percentage of water tiles to be generated in the map.
        maxWaterTilePercent - An integer from 0 to 64 (inclusive) representing the maximum percentage of water tiles to be generated in the map.
        API Note:
        Note that to allow the user to choose a single fixed percentage of water tiles, the parameters minWaterTilePercent and maxWaterTilePercent can both be set to the same value.
        Implementation Note:
        The functionality to change these percentages was not included in the constructor since changing these values is completely optional, given that they already have a default value when the object is created. Moreover, the function only allows a percentage as high as 64% since in the worst case (a 5x5 map) this is the maximum percentage of water tiles allowed. This is due to the restriction in the method function generate() which prevents tiles next to the treasure tile from being set to water tiles. Hence, the treasure tile can have at most 8 grass tiles around it. Therefore (8 grass + 1 treasure)/25 = 36% which cannot be water tiles.

      • setMinPlayableTilesPercentage

        public void setMinPlayableTilesPercentage(int minPlayableTilesPercentage)
        This function is used to change the default minimum percentage of tiles from which the player must be able to reach the treasure tile. It changes the value stored in the member minWinnableTilesPercent.
        Parameters:
        minPlayableTilesPercentage - An integer in the range 1 to 100 representing the percentage of tiles from which the player must be able to reach the treasure.
        Implementation Note:
        The functionality to change this value was not added in the constructor since the member minWinnableTilesPercent is given a default value when the map is initialized.

      • generate

        public void generate()
        Generates the tiles for the BasicMap object randomly.
        Specified by:
        generate in class Map
        API Note:
        Note that this function should also set the Map.treasurePos member so that it can be used later in the function Map.isPlayable().
        Implementation Note:
        The function generates one treasure tile and randomly generates a number of water tiles. The percentage of randomly generated water tiles to maps tiles is within the lower and upper bounds specified by the members minWaterTilePercent and maxWaterTilePercent. The function also makes sure that none of the water tiles that are generated are placed adjacent to the treasure tile.

      • isPlayable

        public boolean isPlayable()
        This function checks if the player can reach the treasure starting from a minimum percentage of grass tiles. This percentage is specified in the member minWinnableTilesPercent, and can be changed using the function setMinPlayableTilesPercentage(int). The function also computes from which tiles the player can reach the treasure.
        Specified by:
        isPlayable in class Map
        Returns:
        true if the player can reach the treasure starting from at least minWinnableTilesPercent% of the grass tiles and false otherwise.
        API Note:
        The treasure tile does not count towards the total number of playable tiles, since the player cannot start from this tile. Also, due to rounding, this function may actually check that the map contains a percentage of playable tiles less than that specified in minWinnableTilesPercent.
        Implementation Note:
        The function carries out a Depth First Search (DFS) traversal of the map starting from the treasure tile to check which grass tiles are actually connected to the treasure tile. The function also creates an array of booleans (Map.winnableTiles) representing the tiles which are connected to the treasure tile. The elements of this array can be accessed using the Map.isPositionWinnable(Position) function.
